text: Leptochloa chinensis, commonly known as red sprangletop, Asian sprangletop, or Chinese sprangletop, is a grass species. It is native to regions of Africa, Asia, and Oceania. Places it is found include Japan, South Korea, Southeast Asia, Australia, Papua New Guinea, Eswatini, West Africa, Fiji and Samoa. It is known to be a pasture grass and is a livestock grazing feed grass specialty, but in some cases it is a common rice weed. The 1889 book 'The Useful Native Plants of Australia’ records that it is "an excellent pasture grass, much relished by stock ; it has tender panicles, and grows from two to three feet high. It is not endemic in Australia but is found in New South Wales and Queensland" == Gallery == File:千金子 Leptochloa chinensis 20190509105938 01.jpg File:千金子 Leptochloa chinensis 20190509105938 02.jpg ==References== Category:Chloridoideae Category:Grasses of Africa Category:Grasses of Asia Category:Flora of tropical Asia Category:Flora of Fiji Category:Flora of Japan Category:Flora of Samoa Category:Flora of South Korea Category:Flora of Swaziland Category:Poales of Australia
title: Leptochloa chinensis
